
## Quarto for Python, in a nutshell

In Quarto's `.qmd` files, you write Markdown and code, just like `.ipynb`. Add some `YAML` configuration and Quarto does the intermediate steps. It integrates well with VSCode and Jupyter. Once you create your Quarto `.qmd` file, just render it with `quarto render file.qmd`.

```{mermaid}
graph LR
Q[.qmd] --> A
subgraph Quarto
    A[.ipynb] --> B(("Pandoc"))
    B --> C[.md]
    B --> D[.tex] 
    D --> F((Xetex))
    C --> I((Hugo))
    style B fill:#FF6655AA
    style F fill:#88ffFF
    style I fill:#88ffFF
end
    B ----> E[.doc]
    B ----> H[.pptx]
    F --> G[.pdf]
    I --> J[.html]
```
